blog.description:

summary: More for your Tony/T'Challa/M'Baku prompts! (And thank you so much for giving me permission to submit more, I've been bursting...
question: More for your Tony/T'Challa/M'Baku prompts! (And thank you so much for giving me permission to submit more, I've been bursting since your prompt first went up.) How about a shifter au with panther!T'Challa and silver back gorilla!M'Baku being all fierce and powerful and trying to figure out what Tony is. My vote is either for white-tailed buck with massive antlers or something small and adorable like a Capybara that chills with everybody.
answer:
I didn’t exactly use either of your suggestions … but I hope you like it anyways!

T’challa and M’baku were both quite powerful alpha shifters. T’challa had already been a panther, just genetically, but he was further strengthened by the heart-shaped herb. His shifted form stood at M’baku’s shoulder height, indisputably a massive cat.

M’baku’s shifted form was a regular sized silverback gorilla. That is to say, also quite large. Combine that with their tallness in human form, and people often found them at least a little bit intimidating. If not alone, then definitely as a pair.

Quite a formidable pair they made, mated leaders of Panther and Jabari tribes. They’d united all the clans, bringing the utmost peace upon Wakanda. And they were quite happy, just the two of them … that is until they met a certain omega shifter named Tony Stark.

America had quite a different culture compared to the rest of the world. Most countries put a lot of emphasis on shifted forms. There were elaborate rituals and ceremonies that revolved heavily around shifting that ‘developed’ countries were beginning to do less and less.

Even though Tony Stark was Iron Man and very much in the public eye, nobody knew what his shifted form was. There was speculation, of course. A popular vote was kitten, although his haters were more likely to say things that they considered nasty, like a shrew.

When T’challa and M’baku began to court Tony they assumed he’d at least tell them. And as he became more and more enraptured with Wakanda and began more frequent trips, they’d invited him to join the shifting ceremonies. But no. Tony remained in human form, and refused to disclose what his shift was.

“If we guess correctly would you tell us?” M’baku asked once.

“Fine.” Tony had said.

From that moment on, a least once a day, each of them would find a new animal to try. They simply couldn’t get it.

It turned out they didn’t have to. Loki attacked New York while the kings were staying in Stark Tower so naturally, they helped out with the fight. Tony was hit with twice. The first time the bolt of scarlet light made his suit disappear. He free-fell through the sky until Clint’s Hawk form caught him and deposited him safely on the ground.

The stubborn fool wouldn’t get to safety. M’baku and T’challa (in their shifted forms) tried to protect him as best they could- but alas, a streak of light blue made its way past them and hit Tony square in the chest.

M’baku bellowed and T’challa roared. They ran towards where Tony had been standing. The dust cleared and-

The cutest creature they had ever seen was standing where their mate had been, shivering and making a strange whistling sound through it’s adorable nose.

It caught sight of them and startled, like it was about to bolt. They halted, shifting back into their human forms, completely ignoring the battle that was winding down around them.

Apparently Loki had also been distracted by Tony, and Thor had finally managed to subdue him. Rhodey landed next to them and stepped out of his suit with a sigh.

“He’s a dikdik,” T’challa breathed. Neither of them had been expecting an African animal. No wonder Tony liked Wakanda and the heat so much. It was all both of them could do not to start cooing over him.

“Yeah,” Rhodey said. “And you shift into one of his natural predators. So let me.” He approached the tiny little antelope, one hand out, and Tony went to him calmly, even allowing Rhodey to pick him up.

Loki let out a cackle. “Ha! The great Iron man, that miniscule little creature.”

“Undo your spell, Loki,” Thor growled. “Stark does not wish to be seen like this.”

The trickster shrugged. “He can shift back whenever he’s calm enough to do so.”

M’baku and T’challa looked at Tony expectantly, surprised to see him still in dikdik form.

Rhodey winced. “That’s why he never shifts. It’s hard for him to get out of it.”

“Let us take him back to the tower and calm him down then,” T’challa suggested.

“Fine. Make sure he doesn’t run. He’s super fast.” Rhodey transferred the squirming body over to M’baku, who cradled Tony with reverence. “Hello there little one,” he murmured. “I can’t imagine why you wouldn’t wish to share this beauty with us.”

Tony started to make the whistling noise again.

summary:

summary:
Smile
Pairings: Steve Rogers x reader
Summary: It’s all your fault, everything is and you can’t help but smile because of...
body:
Smile

Pairings: Steve Rogers x reader

Summary: It’s all your fault, everything is and you can’t help but smile because of it

Warinings: ANGST, torture, language, death, suicide mention, kidnapping, toxic coping mechanism

~~

It was one year ago, one year ago you were captured tortured in HYDRA. After one mission that wasn’t planned right you’re whole life turned upside down. You’re legs were shredded to pieces after the torture they put you through everyday. They wanted information you didn’t have, if you wouldn’t tell them, they would either hit you 10 times with a spiked baseball bat or kill an innocent person. Since you are, or rather were, an avenger you couldn’t let them be killed. So you let them use you as a human baseball, punching bag, and on the special occasions a human torch.

It killed you from the inside and you knew when you herd the soft rumbling of a fight that your coworkers were there to save you. The sad thing was that they were too late. You’ve been there for god knows how long, time starts to slip past you when there is no light of day. You just sat in your cell either unable to move because you’re exhausted or because you don’t want to. So you sit there staring at your hands when the door is kicked in.

Steve stands there his breath is ragged and blood is on his face, they’ve been fighting for you. “Y/n” he breaths out in relieve. “Hey Steve” you plaster a smile on your face. It’s your coping mechanism smiling. You smile when it’s the hardest of days, you smile when you just wake up from a terrible nightmare. You won’t alow yourself to breakdown you can’t afford it.

Steve is a bit taken aback by the happiness you radiate. “Let’s go” he stands out of the way so you could walk out. “Oh no I can’t” you shake your head slightly the smile never faltering from your lips. “Why not?” captain furrows his eyebrows. “My legs don’t work” you shrug. Steve’s eyes widen and he walks towards you and throws your fragile body on his shoulder. You whimper at the harsh contact, but again the smile doesn’t fall.

Steve runs out the base with you on his shoulder and all hell breaks lose. Bullets fly everywhere and one in particular hits Steve, again you keep smiling.

Tony swoops in and flies you both to the quinjet.

“What happend?” Bruce asks as he runs up next to Steve who lays on the ground. “He’s shot. He needs help now!” Tony orders and Bruce starts to work his magic. “We’re losing him!”’Bruce shouts, all the avengers stare in shock as Steve Rogers heart is failing. You arrive in the compound and everyone runs with Steve to the operation room to be saved immediately. You stay back in the quinjet, because you still can’t walk.

You sit and smile, it’s the only thing you know. “Miss should I call someone to get you” FRIDAY’s voice enters the silence. “Oh no that won’t be necessary, I will just need a wheelchair that’s all” you answer and to your wish a wheelchair is automatically rolled towards you. With struggle you sit down in the chair and you move towards the medbay. Time to check on good ol’ cap.

When you enter the room everyone is crying. “What’s wrong you guys?” you smile, like always. “Steve, he- he didn’t make it” Sam says said. “How?” your voice is slightly less happy and the smile is a bit smaller, but they’re still visible. “The bullet punctured his heart, it’s a wonder he even made it this far” Bruce says. “Is it my fault?” you ask the room. “What do you mean is it your fault?” Natasha looks at you quizzically. “Is it my fault he died. You did go there to save me” You say. “It’s not your fault, yes we went there to save you, but see you’re still alive. He would want you to live well” Bucky says. “I guess it’s too bad he died trying to save a dead person” you look down sad. “Dead what do you mean dead?” Thor more demands than asks.

“You should have let me die, I am useless, you traded a life for a life but chose to save the wrong one. We all know Steve’s dead is my fault and we all know everyone lost a piece of themselves today because of this. So don’t even think that saving me was worth it. It’s my fault that this happend and that’s why I made my decision. I will be leaving the avengers and go wherever. I’m a hazard for this team a danger in the plans. Emotionally unstable and physically incapable. So this is goodbye to a great soldier but most importantly a man with strong morals and a loving family and me, a no good little bitch.” you let your smile go for the first time today, your true colours are shown and they are grey.

You’re dead inside and that was the cause of the dead of Steve. If it wasn’t for you he would still be alive and it hurts that you’ll have to live with that, you don’t know how long you’ll be able to do that. The back up plan is ready, so you could see Steve again and tell him how much you’re sorry. But not yet, you deserve to suffer first.

Steve is a bit taken aback by the happiness you radiate. “Let’s go” he stands out of the way so you could walk out. “Oh no I can’t” you shake your head slightly the smile never faltering from your lips. “Why not?” captain furrows his eyebrows. “My legs don’t work” you shrug. Steve’s eyes widen and he walks towards you and throws your fragile body on his shoulder. You whimper at the harsh contact, but again the smile doesn’t fall.

Steve runs out the base with you on his shoulder and all hell breaks lose. Bullets fly everywhere and one in particular hits Steve, again you keep smiling.

Tony swoops in and flies you both to the quinjet.

“What happend?” Bruce asks as he runs up next to Steve who lays on the ground. “He’s shot. He needs help now!” Tony orders and Bruce starts to work his magic. “We’re losing him!”’Bruce shouts, all the avengers stare in shock as Steve Rogers heart is failing. You arrive in the compound and everyone runs with Steve to the operation room to be saved immediately. You stay back in the quinjet, because you still can’t walk.

You sit and smile, it’s the only thing you know. “Miss should I call someone to get you” FRIDAY’s voice enters the silence. “Oh no that won’t be necessary, I will just need a wheelchair that’s all” you answer and to your wish a wheelchair is automatically rolled towards you. With struggle you sit down in the chair and you move towards the medbay. Time to check on good ol’ cap.

When you enter the room everyone is crying. “What’s wrong you guys?” you smile, like always. “Steve, he- he didn’t make it” Sam says said. “How?” your voice is slightly less happy and the smile is a bit smaller, but they’re still visible. “The bullet punctured his heart, it’s a wonder he even made it this far” Bruce says. “Is it my fault?” you ask the room. “What do you mean is it your fault?” Natasha looks at you quizzically. “Is it my fault he died. You did go there to save me” You say. “It’s not your fault, yes we went there to save you, but see you’re still alive. He would want you to live well” Bucky says. “I guess it’s too bad he died trying to save a dead person” you look down sad. “Dead what do you mean dead?” Thor more demands than asks.

“You should have let me die, I am useless, you traded a life for a life but chose to save the wrong one. We all know Steve’s dead is my fault and we all know everyone lost a piece of themselves today because of this. So don’t even think that saving me was worth it. It’s my fault that this happend and that’s why I made my decision. I will be leaving the avengers and go wherever. I’m a hazard for this team a danger in the plans. Emotionally unstable and physically incapable. So this is goodbye to a great soldier but most importantly a man with strong morals and a loving family and me, a no good little bitch.” you let your smile go for the first time today, your true colours are shown and they are grey.

You’re dead inside and that was the cause of the dead of Steve. If it wasn’t for you he would still be alive and it hurts that you’ll have to live with that, you don’t know how long you’ll be able to do that. The back up plan is ready, so you could see Steve again and tell him how much you’re sorry. But not yet, you deserve to suffer first.

Pairings: Steve Rogers x reader

blog.description: Lover of Wholesome Things • Feminist • She/Her pronouns • PTSD-Haver • Cat Mom • Vegan Appreciative, but not Vegan • Marvel • HP • Lovecraft • SuperWhoLock

summary: Tony has to be scared out of his mind like, all the time
body:
Tony has to be scared out of his mind like, all the time

So we all know Tony has PTSD. It’s not even a fan-theory, there’s literally an entire movie franchise about it. As someone who also has PTSD, I recognize his struggles and every day am thankful for RDJ’s ability to capture pretty much everything about dealing with it day-to-day accurately.

But then you add a kid into the mix. His kid, his snarky science-child, rounding out the family he chose with a kid who wants nothing from him but his time.

I have a sister who’s Peter’s age during Homecoming. I raised the girl from the time I was 12 until I joined the Army at 17.

If he loves Peter even half as much as I love that kid, then he’s constantly terrified. He wants his kid safe from everything the world can, does, and will throw at him. He wants to scream every time the kid does something risky. After becoming close to Peter, I’d imagine the YouTube video of him stopping a bus with his bare hands is enough to make him want to shake the kid for being so goddamn reckless. Yes, it was years ago, and yes, the kid can very clearly take care of himself. Doesn’t matter. That is his child and for the love of Pete (“ha, see what I did there?” “Mr. Stark, you’re such a dork”) can he stay out of potentially lethal situations for five minutes?

There’s a flip-side to that feeling of overprotective-ness as well though. It’s the, “if I don’t prepare them for the danger of the world, they’ll die, and that’s on me.”

Tony saying that in Homecoming was honestly so impactful to me that I had to pause the movie and go cry. It is the exact emotion, the exact thought process, of someone that suffers like me, like Tony. You want to shelter them, you want to protect them, you need to prepare them, and if all that fails, it’s on you. It’s your fault.

Infinity War broke my heart. I know exactly what Tony had to be thinking as his kid, his child, his Peter, crumbled to dust between his fingers. It’s the same feeling I’d have if anything happened to my sister. It’s every worst nightmare come to life and it’s still worse than you’d expected. It’s your heart shattering and your brain, usually full of insidious your fault your fault whispers about every bump and bruise and mistake screaming every single one of them at you.

Tony Stark is terrified. Tony Stark is grieving. Tony Stark is battered and tired.

But.

Tony Stark is unbroken and full of fury. Once the grief recedes, the fury is there and will keep him going until his kid is back.
